content.description: Huntington’s disease, an autosomal dominant disorder, is caused by a mutation in the <math alttext="H T T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>H</mi><mi>T</mi><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> gene. The <math alttext="H T T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>H</mi><mi>T</mi><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> gene contains multiple repeats of the nucleotide sequence <math alttext="C A G" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CAG</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. A person with fewer than 35 <math alttext="C A G" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CAG</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> repeats in the <math alttext="H T T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>H</mi><mi>T</mi><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> gene is unlikely to show the neurological symptoms of Huntington’s disease. A person with 40 or more <math alttext="C A G" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CAG</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> repeats almost always becomes symptomatic. Due to errors in meiosis, an individual without symptoms of Huntington’s disease can produce gametes with a larger number of <math alttext="C A G" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>CAG</mtext></mrow></math> repeats than there are in their somatic cells.
content.question: A woman develops Huntington’s disease. Her father had the disorder. Her mother did not, and there is no history of the disorder in the mother’s family. Which of the following best explains how the woman inherited Huntington’s disease?

choices.label: She inherited an allele with fewer than 40 <math alttext="C A G" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CAG</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> repeats in the <math alttext="H T T " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>H</mi><mi>T</mi><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> gene because her mother did not have Huntington’s disease.

She inherited an allele with more than 40 <math alttext="C A G" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CAG</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> repeats in the <math alttext="H T T " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>H</mi><mi>T</mi><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> gene from her father.
Her mother produced eggs that all have more than 40 repeats in the <math alttext="H T T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>H</mi><mi>T</mi><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> gene.

Her mother produced eggs that all have fewer than 40 <math alttext="C A G" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CAG</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> repeats in the <math alttext="H T T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>H</mi><mi>T</mi><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> gene.

content.answer: She inherited an allele with more than 40 <math alttext="C A G" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CAG</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> repeats in the <math alttext="H T T " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>H</mi><mi>T</mi><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> gene from her father.
